unnormalised: So, someone asked about the types of govt. issued ID documents in India, huh? Well, strap in, bhai, 'cause it's more than just your face on a card. First, you got the granddaddy of 'em all: Aadhaar. This 12 digit number (like 1234-5678-9012, but hopefully more original) is practically your digital soul these days. Need a SIM card? Aadhaar. Want a bank account? Aadhaar. Trying to prove you're not a ghost? Aadhaar!
normalised: So, someone asked about the types of government issued I-D documents in India, huh? Well, strap in, bhai, 'cause it's more than just your face on a card. First, you got the granddaddy of 'em all: Aadhaar. This twelve digit number (like one thousand two hundred and thirty four hyphen five thousand six hundred and seventy eight hyphen nine thousand and twelve, but hopefully more original) is practically your digital soul these days. Need a S-I-M card? Aadhaar. Want a bank account? Aadhaar. Trying to prove you're not a ghost? Aadhaar!

unnormalised: Then there's the Voter ID, or EPIC, which feels like it’s shouting at you. This one’s your ticket to complain about the govt, ironically provided *by* the govt. Look for a alphanumeric code like ABC1234567 on it. Don't lose it, or you’ll be explaining to the polling booth officer that you *swear* you’re a real voter.
normalised: Then there's the Voter I-D, or E-P-I-C, which feels like it’s shouting at you. This one’s your ticket to complain about the government, ironically provided by the government. Look for an alphanumeric code like A-B-C one two three four five six seven on it. Don't lose it, or you’ll be explaining to the polling booth officer that you swear you’re a real voter.

unnormalised: Of course, we can't forget the trusty PAN card. Mostly for tax purposes, but also handy if you want to feel important while swiping it at a fancy restaurant. It’s got a code like ABCDE1234F, so keep it safe from the chai stains. Remember getting mine, felt like I’d finally “adulted”.
normalised: Of course, we can't forget the trusty P-A-N card. Mostly for tax purposes, but also handy if you want to feel important while swiping it at a fancy restaurant. It’s got a code like A-B-C-D-E one two three four F, so keep it safe from the chai stains. Remember getting mine, felt like I’d finally “adulted”.

unnormalised: And last but not least, the passport, your get-out-of-India-free card! It's got all sorts of numbers and codes like Passport No. Z1234567. Remember to renew it before your dream Goa trip turns into an unexpected extended stay due to expired documents. Trust me, nobody wants that kind of souvenir.
